resources.string: Really erase your saved game? All of your progress will be lost!
Disabling sound may improve performance on some devices.
Enables safety hacks for broken devices (Cliq, etc), but causes some visual artifacts. Try this if you have problems.
Use the trackball click or directional pad center button to attack.
EXPERIMENTAL! Tilt the phone left and right to drive the Android around. Good for devices with no trackball or d-pad.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the trackball, d-pad, or optical sensor.
Adjusts the sensitivity of the tilt controls.
Customize keys for phones with hard keyboards.
Sends anonymous play statistics to a server to help us make this game more fun.
Replica Island was made by Chris Pruett and Genki Mine, and produced by Tom Moss.
Go to the Replica Island web site
Special Thanks to Adrian Havill, Casey Richardson, Jason Chen, Tim Mansfield, and the Android Team for their support of this project.
Portions of this game are modifications based on work created and shared by Google and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 3.0 Attribution License.
Output various logs to logcat. This option will slow the game down.

Thanks for downloading Replica Island.

 New in this version:
 	• Fixed blackouts and crashes on Cliq, Backflip, etc. If you have problems try Safe Mode in the options screen.
 	• Improved controls, especially for Droid and other d-pad devices.
 	• Added Motion Sensitivity option to control options. Optical pad users (HTC Desire, Samsung Moment, etc) may want to turn sensitivity down a bit.
 	• Various performance and stability improvements.
 
 As of version 1.3, more than 500,000 users have downloaded Replica Island. Thank you for your support! 
 
 New in version 1.21:
 	• Fixed crash when adjusting tilt sensitivity on Samsung Moment.
 	• Added debug log option. 
 
 New in version 1.2:
 	• Crash fixes and general stability improvements. 
 	• Keyboard configuration for devices with hard keyboards. 
 	• Tilt control sensitivity controls. 
 	• Fixed missing graphics on confusing Memory #034 puzzle. 
 
 
 This is an open source project. If you are interested in how it works, or would like to use it to make your own games, check out the source at our web site, replicaisland.net. 
 
 Also note that this game sends anonymous play statistics back to a server. If you’d rather not allow that, you can turn it off in the options screen.
New in this version: Fix blackouts on broken phones (Cliq, Backflip, etc), improved controls, adjustable control sensitivity, various performance and stability improvements.
